title: Companion sans and small caps for Gentium?
content:
I’m looking for a suitable sans and small caps faces to use with Gentium, since this beautiful (and free!) font comes with neither.

Lucida Sans seems to be a good match, but it lacks caps and old-style numerals. Still suitable, though. I have no clue about which small caps face to use. I was thinking Apolline by Porchez, but I’d rather get some informed opinions before laying out the cash.

Gentium is here: [http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site\_id=nrsi&item\_id=Gentium](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055529/http:/scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site_id=nrsi&item_id=Gentium "http://scripts.sil.org/cms/scripts/page.php?site\_id=nrsi&item\_id=Gentium")

 [‹ "Designing Type" by Karen Cheng: A great book!](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055529/http:/typophile.com/node/20510 "Go to previous forum topic") [TrueType vs. OpenType ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055529/http:/typophile.com/node/20474 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Palatine

comments.content: Mike Abbink’s new [FF Milo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122055529/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Milo) is a pretty good alternative to Lucida Sans.

Didn’t Gentium get open-sourced? If so you could make your own and donate them back into the effort. It would be wrong to mix the use of the font with obviously capitalisitc efforts ;-)

Cheers, Si
